item.title: The influence of translation ambiguity on bilinguals' reading in L1
item.description: This is a project I did with my supervisor Dr. Debra Jared at Western University and the RAs in our lab: Yae Ram Kim, Jia-Wei Shih, and Alexandra Sherwin. What is translation ambiguity? We say that translation ambiguity occurs when a word in one language has more than one translation in another language, and this is often due to semantic ambiguity in one of the languages. For example, the English ambiguous word bark is translated into two distinct words in French, “aboiement” for dog bark and “ecorce” for tree bark.
